column4: Hello everyone, I just installed Ubuntu and only problem i am having is i cant get nVidia X Server to recognize im using a LCD monitor not a CRT monitor.
Anyone happen to know if there is any bugs the prevent my nVidia 8800GT from noticing my LCD screen?
I have an nVidia 8800 and have had no problems - what is the output of xrandr
I honestly dont know what that means, but i cant get X Server to notice im using a LCD monitor it says im using a CRT.
Menu->Preferences->Display... does it show you your monitor correctly?
are you using the nvidia or open source drivers?
do you have a Nvidia settings entry in either the Preferences or System ?
It only shows CRT Monitor and i cant chane it.
all I can suggest is you run through the xserver initialisation again -  sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
im going to try that now and c what happens
Alright so in Unistalled the NVIDIA Drivers and Reinstalled them and im still at the same problem i cant change my display off CRT to my LCD.
bookmark i did. i only have this monitor.
